task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 15°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I need to see its full vertical structure; rotating upward will reveal the roofline which is currently out of view at pitch 0°.
I need to see both the base and roof of the building for height estimation; currently pitched up at 30°, so I'll look down to locate the ground level first.
Having observed the roof at +30° pitch and base at -30° pitch from ~9m distance, the total vertical angle spans 60°; using trigonometry (9m * tan(60°) ≈ 15.6m) gives a reasonable height estimate.
